snippet: Joseph Cedar’s Israeli film “Footnote,” a tragicomic tale of rivalry between two Talmudic scholars, father and son, opens in New York on March 9.
abstract: Joseph Cedar film Footnote, a tragicomic tale of rivalry between two Talmudic scholars, father and son, at Hebrew University in Jerusalem, was a contender for this year's foreign-language Academy Award; Cedar says that Israeli films often struggle to find their connection to the larger Israel, and feels that his latest film touches on this identity.
lead_paragraph: Joseph Cedar’s Israeli film “Footnote,” a tragicomic tale of rivalry between two Talmudic scholars, father and son, opens in New York on March 9.

headline.main: Ego and Envy, So It Is Written
headline.print_headline: Ego and Envy, So It Is Written
